column2: Dramatic Footage Shows Plane Skidding Off Runway at O'Hare Airport in Chicago
column3: A plane slid off the runway due to icy conditions at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport on Monday morning, November 11, as cold weather swept across the state. American Airlines told Storyful that flight 4125, which was traveling from Greensboro, North Carolina, to Chicago, slid off the runway upon landing at around 7.45 am on Monday as a result of icy conditions. The airline said no injuries were reported and all 38 passengers and three crew members were transported to the terminal at O'Hare airport safely. Local media reported that the incident prompted a ground stop at the airport, halting all landings until around 8.30 am. Airlines at O'Hare and Midway airports canceled hundreds of flights on Monday as the National Weather Service issued a winter weather advisory for the state. Credit: Joseph Lian via Storyful

column3: Eagles running back Darren Sproles may have reached the end of the line. Sproles injured his hip flexor muscle in practice this week and is out for the season, the team announced. column2: Cassius Winston posts double-double a day after his brother's death
column3: Michigan State Spartans guard Cassius Winston came into Sunday's game against Binghamton with a heavy heart. His brother, Zachary Winston, died Saturday night when he stepped in front of an Amtrak train, according to the Detroit Free Press.

column2: Woman arrested for DWI after car crashes through St. Charles convenience store
column3: A woman was arrested on suspicion of driving drunk after police said she drove her car through the front of an On The Run convenience store on Friday. Nobody was hurt. The St. Charles Police Department said it responded to 1401 South 5th Street in St. Charles at about 12:30 p.m. A 49-year-old woman was the only person in the car, and police arrested her on suspicion of a DWI.
